result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Ward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: DNA sample previously provided, however, defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

Current: 5627 Byrd Ave Aot 101, Racine, WI 53404   (Effective: 11-30-2015)
Prior: 5627 Byrd Ave # 101, Racine, WI 53404
ZCI report

Ct 1: 961.41(1m)(h)1-Possession w/intent-THC; Ct 2: 946.49(1)(b)-Felony BJ. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Plea hearing at 11-30-2015 09:30 am

Defendant Christopher J Ward in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Defendant Christopher J Ward in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State indicates the investigator spoke with him last night at 4:30 pm indicating there was an interview with a witness that was recorded that the investigator did not advise the State of. The report was uploaded to Phoenix last night at 11:31 pm. The investigator indicates that there is a DVD as well but none of this information was provided to the State prior to trial. The State asks for adj to not only obtain this information but to share same with defense.
Defense moves for dismissal. In the alternative, defense is asking for deft's release as defendant has not waived his speedy trial demand.

BTC:  There is no good cause for adj and the request is denied. Case is dismissed w/o prej. Bond in 15CF673 is modified to signature bond. Same terms and conditions.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial at 09-29-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Christopher J Ward in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Defendant Christopher J Ward in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Maggie Techert.
The State indicates that he was advised over the weekend that the defendant wished to change his plea so witnesses were cancelled. Defense indicates that the State gave her a global offer and ultimately, the defendant has decided he did not wish to accept the offer. Defense indicates that they are stipulating that deft was read his Miranda rights and they concede there are no Miranda/Goodchild issues.  The State indicates that all trial witnesses have been cancelled. The Court conducts a colloquy with the defendant regarding his waiver of his right to have an evidentiary hearing regarding his Miranda/Goodchild rights. 

BTC: Other matters to be bumped to accommodate trial. Set out for 3 weeks. Miranda/Goodchild hearing to be conducted right before trial.  Jury trial scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Motion hearing on September 14, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Christopher J Ward in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Defendant Christopher J Ward in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
FPT on 15CF716. Defense has filed notice of alibi. 15CF716 is set for JT 9/15. The State indicates they sent their investigator to investigate the alibi notice. Subpoena's are out. No discovery issues by either party. Sequestration is granted, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 (conducted prior to voir dire), 7 (no other acts proffered by defense). Granted. No other acts proffered by the State, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 are granted. 7 is not granted. 8 is already ordered. 9-no break in voir dire, 10 is granted, 11. 12 not granted. No Daubert issues, no crime lab issues. Anticipated length 1 1/2 days total. 1 alternate, 5 strikes. The Court will give the following instructions: 50, 103, 148, 55, 58, 300, 140, 101. 

BTC: matter remains calendared for trial.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
